conclusion: The working principle of the electromagnetic railgun is that the projectile to be launched can move freely between two parallel rails and maintain good contact with the rails.
Current flows in from one rail, passes through the conductive projectile, and then flows back through the other rail.
The rail current generates a magnetic field perpendicular to the plane of the rails at the projectile (which can be considered as a uniform magnetic field).
The electrified projectile is then propelled at high speed along the rails due to the Lorentz force acting on it.

Xiao Ming purchased a railgun model online, with a rail length of L = 0.5 m, a parallel rail spacing of d = 0.02 m, a projectile mass of m = 0.02 kg, a rail current of I = 10 A, and a magnetic field strength of B = 1 T.
The force F acting on the projectile due to the Lorentz force can be calculated using the formula F = BIL, resulting in F = 0.2 N.
Using Newton's second law F = ma, the acceleration a is calculated as a = F/m = 10 m/s^2.
The exit velocity v can be found using the kinematic equation v^2 = u^2 + 2as, resulting in v = sqrt(10) m/s.
Power P is given by P = Fv, resulting in P = 0.632 W.
